fields.description:
h2. Description

When adding a module to a project, the list of available versions shows only the ones compatible with the chosen SDK. For example, ti.cloudpush 3.3.0 will not show up if the SDK chosen is 3.2.3.

The issue is when chosing the [latest] option: in that case, the system is using the latest version, and the build fails because ti.cloudpush 3.3.0 is not compatible with SDK 3.2.3
fields.summary: CLI: Choosing the latest version of a module does not pick the latest compatible one

comments.body:
The suggestion to fix this is the following:

* cloudpush 3.3.0 has a minimum version of Titanium SDK 3.3.0
* cloudpush 3.2.1 has a minimum version of Titanium SDK 3.2.0

When picking 3.2.3 SDK, and choosing "latest", we need to find the module that still has a compatible SDK match. In this case, 3.3.0 cloudpush requires 3.3.0 SDK, so we pick an earlier module, in this case 3.2.1
This was not a duplicate any more. This still needs to be addressed.

Verified fix on:

Mac OSX 10.9.4
Appcelerator Studio, build:3.4.0.201409161950
Titanium SDK build:  33.4.0.v20140918202513
Titanium CLI, build: 3.4.0-rc4
Alloy: 1.5.0-rc2 
Xcode6.0.1

Added the ti.map module and when I built originally the included ti.map module was 2.0.3, changed the minsdk to 3.6.0.GA and then the rebuilt, this time the included t.map was 2.0.2 and there were no errors.

Closing ticket
